lexUnit.name: forearm.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the part of a person's arm extending from the elbow to the wrist or the fingertips.

sentence.text: The sleeves of his pale blue shirt were rolled up over his muscly forearms .
4 Placing her left forearm against his elbow joint , the defender applies pressure downwards .
4 She completes the block with her outer forearm , in a walking stance .
She gave a shaky little laugh , holding out her skinny forearm to display the number written there in blue biro .
The milk was hot on the roof of his mouth and he was sharply aware of the Woman sitting there , the sleeves of the night-shirt falling away from her strong , brown forearms .
The cuts were always superficial and usually consisted of between 20 and 40 neat parallel scratches on her wrist and forearm .
The cuffs were rolled back to reveal tanned forearms .
` I was clipping the hedges , " said a colleague with red forearms .
Her forearm below the elbow was bruised .
He will tell you if you are rotating the left forearm properly on the backswing .

Enhancing the Carlton 's diminutive appearance still further is some very Stratocaster-like chamfering on its upper side to produce the familiar contouring beloved of rib cages and right-hand forearms everywhere .
She started to turn , just in time to glimpse and duck beneath the hairy forearm that was sweeping towards the side of her head .
Her forearms , huge and smooth , were like two hams ready for hanging .
He broke both bones in his right forearm and will be in plaster for eight weeks .
Mr Dovaston said Magee had a tattoo on his left forearm of a heart with the letter A inside , with the names Pat and Joe underneath .
She had a fairly thick neck and her forearms , well , the only way to describe them was meaty .
Maxim had a sore forearm and stomach , a slight headache and a torn seam in his light jacket .
` It 's possible he is a manual worker as he has quite strong forearms .
